data.title: Poor service
data.text: My waiter who smelled of liquor threw menus on the table while talking on his cell phone. He said "I can't take your order. I'm on the phone." I quit going to Therapy because of this individual only to find him at Cregeens. My out of town guests were appalled so we left. Good luck.

data.title: I hated this experience
data.text: The atmosphere was great, wonderful building. However, I was there to eat. The food was not great. If you are there to drink-you are in better luck...

data.title: "ChanEvan"
data.text:
A hoppin late-night place on Super-Tuesday-Two (I felt like celebrating!) 

Warehouse-style decor with nooks & loads of green paint, of course.  A no-band night, a variety of music with a beat played, not too loud. 

I took a comfy seat @ the Bar & watched the action.  

College crowd (those with no morning classes on Wednesday 😝 ) enjoyed beer & conversation.  

Cregeens (pron. kree'-gun) Cheeseburger -- a large juicy patty on a large bun -- was served with crispy Chips (so much better than boring fries) & hit the spot. 

Tons of beer choices / Barefoot & Beringer White Wines / Yellowtail Reds.  

Sandwich Menu included Signature Reuben / Irish Dip / Irish Pretzel / BLT / Pulled Pork Sandwich / Cregeens Steak Sandwich.  

The Locals said they love the Sunday Brunch.  

I liked the Pub & will return.  

Bread & Butter Pudding with Jameson Whiskey Sauce / Chocolate Lava Cake with Jameson looked awesome!

data.title: Best place to visit downtown on a Sunday night
data.text:
Visited this place on a Sunday night, after realizing it was the only open place on Sundays. Don't worry though, there is plenty of seating, as there are a hundred tables, I bet. Limited seating at the bar though.
Try the Irish Nacho's; is't interestingly good, even considering the added sauerkraut.

data.title: Good burgers and fish and chips.
data.text: We ate here on a Friday night early before the crowds.  The food was pretty good.  We had fish, burgers, and sausage with potatoes.   The service was friendly.  We were turned off by the sticky tables.  The server said it was some sort of finish that once wiped it would dry and be sticky again.  I guess those who go in there to party and drink don't mind but those of us who want a nice meal do.  Maybe adding tablecloths or something would be helpful.  I think they are mainly catering to the drinkers and are not much in tune with those who just enjoy good food so that problem will most likely not be remedied but if you can handle your drink glass, sleeves, and napkin sticking to the table it is worth it.  The burger was really tasty and juicy--one of the best I have had in town.   My son and husband enjoyed the sausage and fish and chips as well.

data.title: Great food and people
data.text: Stopped here for lunch while on a road trip. The food was great and beer was better. The owner/manager was so nice too and I loved the old building it was in

data.title: Great Place to Grab a Drink
data.text: I like this place the live music is always good & the staff is excellent. I haven't really ever eaten anything but their brunch looks excellent
